group_1.textLeft: Hm. To sum it up, you aren't satisfied with your@own script?

group_1.textRight: Thatâ€™s right...
I thought my script had turned out well when I@finished it...
But now that I've watched the run-through, it no@longer feels right...

group_1.textLeft: Well, checking if everything comes together nicely@is what full rehearsals are meant for and all.
Can you pinpoint the exact moment something felt@amiss to you?

group_1.textRight: It was the last scene...
When the vampire, boiling with rage, fought the@deciding battle with the sister...
That's when something started bothering me a@little.
Whether it was the build up that led to that scene,@or the lines themselves, I don't really know...

group_1.textLeft: Why, isn't that the centerpiece of the story?

group_1.textRight: It is...

group_1.textLeft: So there's a problem with such an important@scene...
I'd really like to help you figure it out, but...
It's unfortunate, but we're complete amateurs@when it comes to scenario writing.

group_1.textRight: Yeah, wouldn't want to throw you off even more@with some useless advice.
I didn't feel particularly bothered at any point@while practicing either.

group_1.textLeft: Maybe it's something that only an artist would@be able to notice...

group_1.textRight: Maybe...

group_1.textLeft: Either way, you can relax, Karin.
If it's just a couple changes to the last scene,@we can handle it no problem!
Indeed, we actors shall back you up with our@acting however we can.
Feel free to contemplate the issue until the@deadline.

group_1.textRight: You guys...![chara:101201:lipSynch_0][wait:1.0][chara:101201:cheek_0][chara:101201:face_mtn_ex_011.exp.json][chara:101201:lipSynch_1]@Yeah, I'm going to give it my all.

group_1.textLeft: In conclusion, the best thing for us to do right@now is to keep practicing.

group_1.textRight: True.

group_1.textLeft: Rewatching the play might give Artist a clue in@regards to adjusting the script.

group_1.textRight: Makes sense. Let's not delay it any further and@resume our practice right away then!
Please start from the fight scene in the middle@act.

group_1.textLeft: That would mean we need to start from the...
"Bwahahaha... I've been waiting for you,@Sister!"
Line in the script, correct?

group_1.textRight: Yup!

group_1.textLeft: Ahahahaha... Hahahaha...
Ahahahahahaha!!!!
I've been waiting for far, far too long!!
Sister!! My mortal enemy!

group_1.textRight: Um... Well... Your delivery is too exaggerated@all of a sudden...
W-what's going on...?

group_1.textLeft: Oh? The dialogue made you feel like something@was out of place, so...
I thought that changing my acting might make@it feel right...

group_1.textRight: [chara:101201:effect_emotion_surprise_0][se:7226_shock]You did it for my sake, then!
[chara:101201:effect_emotion_joy_0][se:7222_happy]Thank you!
Your acting has been 100% on point so far,@really...
[chara:101201:effect_emotion_sad_0][se:7224_fall_into]But that felt a little OOC to me just now...

group_1.textLeft: I see. So that was unnecessary...
By the way, Artist... What did you mean when you@said it was "OOC"?

group_1.textRight: It's, uh, how should I explain it...

group_1.textLeft: It's an acronym for "out of character..." Meaning you weren't quite acting in the way the@character would...I believe?

group_1.textRight: That's more or less what I meant.
Aha!

group_1.textLeft: Did you figure something out?

group_1.textRight: That must be it!
I've been misinterpreting the vampire's@personality all along!

group_1.textLeft: So it's your misunderstanding, then...?
